title: How to Draw a Hexagonal Prism

steps.title: Add vertical lines.
steps.content: Add vertical lines. For every visible corner, draw a straight vertical line.

steps.title: Finish the base.
steps.content: Finish the base. Connect the end of the vertical lines to finish the prism base.

steps.title: You now have your solid prism.
steps.content: You now have your solid prism.

steps.title: Color some details to make it look 3D.
steps.content: Color some details to make it look 3D. Add some shadings and lighting. Add a shadow opposite to your light source.

steps.title: Draw a hexagon.
steps.content: Draw a hexagon. This will be your hexagon's top base.

steps.title: Add another hexagon.
steps.content: Add another hexagon. The second hexagon will be your prism's lower base. They should mirror one another.

steps.title: Connect the lines.
steps.content: Connect the lines. Connect each corner of the top hexagon to the bottom hexagon. Knowing this technique will help you make 3D prisms of any figure.

steps.title: The final line art.
steps.content: The final line art. For added effects, make the lines on the back a bit lighter. They should look like they're hidden from view.

steps.title: Draw a polygon
steps.content: Draw a polygon : this works with any shape you can think of like: a square, triangle, pentagon, octagon,hexagon or a decagon. A hexagon is used here.

steps.title: Draw an overlapping polygon
steps.content: Draw an overlapping polygon , roughly the same size and shape. In fact, if you are in a computer drawing program just copy and paste your first shape right next to it.

steps.title: Connect
steps.content: Connect all the corners of the first shape to the congruent corner of the other shape.
